de.eckhartarnold.client
Interface ImageCollectionInfo

All Known Implementing Classes:
ImageCollectionReader 
public interface ImageCollectionInfo

The interface ImageCollectionInfo is for querying the configuration data of the photo album.

ImageCollectionInfo defines several methods that all together return all the configuration data for an image collection that is needed for the photo album, such as configuration options, image locations, file names, resolutions and captions.

Author:
eckhart

Method Summary

Method Detail

getCaptions

java.lang.String[] getCaptions()
Returns the array of caption string for the images. The order of the array corresponds to that of the images, i.e. the first entry of the caption array contains the caption of the first image etc. If an image does not have a caption the array contains an empty String.

Returns:
the array of caption strings

getDirectories

java.lang.String[] getDirectories()
Returns a list of directory names. Each directory is to contain all the images scaled to a specific size class. The directory names contain the "full" path starting with the base URL that is passed to the ImageCollectionInfo constructor.

Returns:
the directory names

getImageNames

java.lang.String[] getImageNames()
Returns the list of image filenames. The filenames do not contain any path information. A file with the same name, e.g. "beautiful_image.jpg" should be contained in every (sub-)directory for different image sizes.

Returns:
the list of image filenames.

getImageSizes

java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,int[][]> getImageSizes()
Returns a dictionary that maps the image file names to their exact sizes. The sizes are pairs of integer values {x,y} and the length and order of the sizes tuple should correspond to the list of directories.

Returns:
the exact sizes of every image.

getInfo

java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getInfo()
Returns a dictionary of information strings. The dictionary may (but does not have to) contain such entries as "title", "subtitle" "bottom line" and any other arbitrary entry. The returned dictionary may be empty. Gallery objects use the information that is provided under the keys: "title", "subtitle", "bottom line".

Returns:
a dictionary with (arbitrary) information on the image collection

hasCaptions

boolean hasCaptions()
Returns true, if at least one image has a caption that is not empty.

Returns:
true, if there are captions
